thread.title: Henrikh Mkhitaryan set to return to Manchester United squad for FA Cup quarter-final against Chelsea
thread.title_full: Henrikh Mkhitaryan set to return to Manchester United squad for FA Cup quarter-final against Chelsea

author: Samuel Luckhurst
title: Henrikh Mkhitaryan set to return to Manchester United squad for FA Cup quarter-final against Chelsea
text:
Henrikh Mkhitaryan went off injured against St Etienne (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Henrikh Mkhitaryan is in line to return to the Manchester United squad for the FA Cup quarter-final against Chelsea . 
The Armenian ace was ruled out of the EFL Cup final with a hamstring problem but is on the road to recovery, reports the Manchester Evening News. 
Mkhitaryan watched Saturday's draw with Bournemouth from the Old Trafford directors' box and is winning his battle to face the Blues next week. 
The midfielder took part in a warm down after the game and Mourinho indicated he might not be risked for United's Europa League tie at FC Rostov on Thursday. Mkhitaryan scored the winner before being forced off (Photo: Tom Purslow) 
"Mkhitaryan is still out," Mourinho told MUTV ahead of the Bournemouth game. 
"He didn’t recover in time for this game. I believe, during the next week, especially for the weekend [Chelsea Cup tie], he will be fine and we don’t have major problems. 
"Bastian [Schweinsteiger] has a little thing but, apart from that, everybody is fine." Mkhitaryan suffered an ankle injury after this challenge by Danny Rose back in December (Photo: PA) 
A thigh injury sidelined Mkhitaryan for a month in the autumn and he also spent two weeks out with an ankle injury following a rough challenge by Tottenham full-back Danny Rose in December. 
Since returning to the first-team in late November, Mkhitaryan has scored six goals, assisted another five, won the Goal of the Month award for December and received six man of the match awards. 
His solo strike at Leicester was also nominated for the February Goal of the Month award. poll loading Who will win the FA Cup? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
